chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lermonte T Toy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS to be served in the La Crosse County Jail, with credit for 1 day time served.
Court set restitution at $6,391.37 payable to Cities and Villages Mutual Insurance Co.

Court ordered the defendant to pay the DNA surcharge and the restitution by 10-17-2024.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lermonte T Toy

records.addlTxt: per clerical error, added due date to the restitution.

Defendant Lermonte T Toy in court, in custody.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan in court for Lermonte T Toy.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.  Arguments heard as to restitution. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS to be served in the La Crosse County Jail, with credit for 1 day time served. 

The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample. Court set restitution at $6,391.37 payable to Cities and Villages Mutual Insurance Co.  Court ordered the defendant to pay the DNA surcharge and the restitution by 10-17-2024.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency. 

20 day appeal rights given.

Defendant Lermonte T Toy in court.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan in court for Lermonte T Toy.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  This matter will be held in person in room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Lermonte T Toy in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a final pre-trial.  Defense filed a request for substitution of Judge.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.  Court VACATES jury trial scheduled on August 29, 2022.  Case adjourned for status conference in Branch 40, Rm 634 CH.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing. Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. Defendant has pending case in Lacrosse as well. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Mindy M. Nolan in court, defendant Lermonte T Toy not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Scheduling Conference. Court ordered bench warrant and withdrew the warrant as the defendant is in custody. Defense request an additional hearing. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Lermonte T Toy in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Lermonte T Toy in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
filed.
Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Prelim Court for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Lermonte T Toy in court via zoom.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan appeared in person.  Defendant Lermonte T Toy in custody.  Jessica Bellows for Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status conference.  The Stated filed an amended information.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Lermonte T Toy in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Lermonte T Toy in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lermonte T Toy appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defense motions to dismiss case.  Arguments heard.  Court STRIKES "substantial bodily harm/soft tissue injury" and amends charge to 946.41(1) misdemeanor Resist Officer.  State to file amended complaint.    Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/ed5b9ae0-0153-fff4-9924-88d8db5a37c1  Status conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.
